data.title: 60th birthday party
data.text: Our party of 6 celebrated a 60th birthday at Randy's Steakhouse on Saturday. We each ordered the fixed price menu, which we all enjoyed.  Before ordering, we received garlic butter with the warm bread.  I ordered the chicken tortilla soup, filet, marinated mushrooms with garlic and bread pudding with ice cream, which I could only finish 1/2 of it.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for letting us be a part of the birthday celebrations -- it was truly such an honor! We love what we do here, and we were all too happy to share our little piece of Frisco with such an amazing group. It was wonderful to see that you enjoyed your meal as much as you did, and we hope to see you back in again soon!

Until then, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
Celebrating our anniversary here was a happy risk, having never been here. True to the other good reviews, our set menu dinner of filet mignon, mashed potatoes, and asparagus was cooked to perfection. 
Service was very good at 5:00. Some restaurants have bad service earliest in the night. Not so here.
I would definitely celebrate here again.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thrilled your anniversary meal was a success! Good service and perfectly-cooked dishes are always what we aim to provide. Whether it's for another celebration or just a quiet evening out, I'd love to welcome you guys back. 

Until then, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mom and Dads 50th
data.text: Great food!  Had an awesome time!  Steaks are phenomenal and service was great.  Had a chance to meet Randy and he was very humble...and a brilliant chef.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Really appreciate this, Anthony! I'm so glad I got to say hi. Can't wait to have you back for another steak. 

Until then, 
Randy B.

data.title: Son's birthday
data.text: Very nice and comfortable setting. Love the old house. Service and food great. My coffee came with a fly in it but that can happen anywhere. Manager took of all coffees and all deserts. Food is pricey but it's good for a special occasion. Would go again.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for the compliments on the house, Kathy! It's become my second home, for sure. As for the food, I'm so glad you enjoyed your meal, and while your coffee should've been pristine from the start, it sounds like your server sorted it all out. I'd definitely love to have you back, incident free! 

Take care, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Randy is the master.
data.text: Randy knows steak. It's simply the best. Love the old house and the wine selection is second to none. Make sure and try the Crossroads White Port.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you! With all the years I've been in the business, I better know a thing or two. In terms of wine, excellent choice with the White Port! 

Until your next craving for steak and wine, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: We went here with my son, his fiancé and her parents to eat dinner and possibly book them for the rehearsal dinner. We had this set up for several weeks and I even spoke to Randy the day before we were coming. Never in my life have I been treated so disrespectfully  and was appalled at the service.  We ordered a bottle of wine to start the evening and had to ask for it after we hadn't received it after 30!minutes. We wanted to try the items that would be available for a rehearsal dinner and they acted like they didn't have a clue what we were talking about. We fully expected to pay for our dinner and the owner came out and said we don't give free food!  The most unprofessional, tackiest place I have ever been to in my life!!

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I would like to sincerely apologize if you felt disrespected in any way -- that was never my intention. Though we talked on the phone, I think there was some miscommunication. Planning a wedding should be fun and exciting, and I'm sorry if we added any stress to that.

I'd love the chance to figure this out, if you'd like to call -- (972) 335-3066.

Whether I hear from you or not, I know you guys will find a great place for the rehearsal.

Best wishes,  
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good steaks
data.text: Dinner out with the hubby during the week, we thought we would try this out. The service was great and our waitress helped us pick out a few good choices. A neighboring table ordered the pork chops, when we saw that delivered, we were jealous, it was huge and looked delicious. Our dinner arrived shortly after and we were not disappointed, New York strip steak was cooked to perfection. I would definitely try the creamed corn, and garlic mashed potatoes. They sides are served family style and that is wonderful for sharing! We will be back! Thank you Randy, it was good to see you talking to customers  and asking how things are going. Great customer service!

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It's great to plan some mid-week date nights, isn't it? And if delicious steaks are involved -- even better! Thanks for all the wonderful compliments, Kelly. I'd definitely love to have you guys back.  

Best, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent steak!
data.text: Great service, and the food was superb. Rib eye was excellent.  It is pricey, but it may become my new special occasion steakhouse!

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sounds like it was your first time with us! I'm so glad that the rib eye and service made it a successful outing. We can't wait to have you back. 

Until your next special occasion, 
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: What a Disappointment
data.text: Heard how wonderful Randy's was so when my Father In Law invited us to dinner I was excited.  Drove 70 miles each way. On arrival the hostess greeted us and escorted us to our table where a young man ( maybe 18) took drink orders and disappeared, no big deal the conversation was great.  When he showed we ordered and was I ever looking forward to my red meat fix.  Ordered the 15oz Ribeye at $34 ala carte medium rare with three sides for the table.  The waiter again no show until the steaks arrived, what a disappointment, my steak was something you buy at Winn Dixie.  Maybe 1/2 inch thick and pretty much grey throughout, no sear marks nada.  Probably half way through our steaks when Dad remarked "didn't we order potatoes?"  Nearly done when the sides showed.  I wasn't about to say anything being a guest.  At 80 dollars a plate I expected more.  Waitstaff young inexperienced, clueless to the wine list, inattentive until it came time for the tip.  My lowly recommendation, go on into Big D and have your steak at Bobs Chophouse

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You made the quite the trip to come see us, and we planned to make it worth your while. I'm disappointed to hear about exactly why that wasn't the case, and I can understand why you're not in any hurry to plan meal #2 with us. Fantastic service and excellent steak are tied for most important when you're at a steakhouse, and we dropped the ball on both. On top of that, we couldn't even get the sides out before you were almost finished with the main event, and it's disappointing that your server wasn't able to speak to the wine list -- we train on that a ton. I need to make sure my team and I are on the same page about all of the things you mentioned, so I appreciate you letting me know what we could have done better. Hope you'll accept my apology for the letdown.

All the best,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Huge disappontment
data.text:
We just ate at Randy's today. We were looking forward to having a great place to have steak nearby. Well, it was a huge disappointment! Drink the extra 15 minutes on the Dallas tollway and get a real steak price for an extra $20/25.

Location - cute ambiance a s it is located in the historic Campbell home in old a Frisco.  Could be cleaned up. And bathroom floor had a cockroach!!!!

Service - horrible. If you are going to hire young people, please train them. As for the waitstaff - slow & not engaging. My us and had to stand up and tell our waitstaff that we wanted our bread!

Drinks - Tuaca lemon drop cocktail was very good.

Appetizers - stay away from the 4 piece mediocre shrimp cocktail for $14.00! Calamari was good.

Entree - 12 oz steak was tasty but nothing to brag home about for the price. Crab cakes was blah...

Bottom line - this is not a cheap steak place. Its a la carte and the steak typically cost $35-40. By the time you add it up - it's about $60-70 pp. so, send a few dollars more and head south. What really got us was the service, or lack thereof.  I think we would have overlooked the price if we had good service.  C'mmon, this is North Dallas - too many choices for good restaurants. Needless to say,  this is he first and last time for us. Too bad....

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Alma, like I said on Yelp, I couldn't agree more that you deserve top-notch service and food when you're paying top dollar -- we're not the cheapest option around, and I know you came because you were looking for something a step above the rest. Right off the bat, a couple things stand out to me as unusual -- we're usually busy on Saturday nights, and we generally get great feedback about the service. I'm disappointed that that wasn't the case for you, and I'm glad you spoke up about it. I'll follow up with the chef about your comments about your meals, and it'd also be ideal to have a conversation your server so I can see what was going on -- hope to hear back from you via private message on Yelp.

Thanks,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Steaks are great.
data.text: We understand that the steaks are great but we have only eaten there once and ordered chicken, big mistake, don't order chicken at a steak house.

Gary, while we do of course specialize in steak, every single thing on that menu should be spectacular. I'll pass your feedback on to the kitchen, and I hope we'll get another shot at really blowing you away. Come back and see us.

data.title: Randy's with friends
data.text: Met with several couples for evening meal. What a great place to meet friends. Food was excellent as well as the service. Randy's had a special that night. The pork chop was excellent as were the salmon and steaks. The sides were served family style and were very generous servings. I would recommend Randy's to anyone. Good value for the quality of food and service.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hank, the Pork Chop was a great choice! I know we're a steakhouse, but we get a kick out of challenging ourselves to serve up great alternatives to beef, too -- I'll let the chef know you said everything was excellent. Thanks for letting us host the get-together, and please tell your friends I said the same!

Cheers,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average Steakhouse - Also, did not honor Gift Card
data.text:
I took my family here in December 2015.  Our party of four arrived two by two, and each arrival was about twenty minutes apart from each other. 

Once everyone arrived, our party was present at Randy's for approximately one hour and twenty-five minutes. It was an 'experience', however, I will save you some time if you are in a hurry, it certainly was not 'fine dining' by any stretch of the imagination. Initially, the service staff on duty was moderately proactive. However, the further we journeyed into our experience, our service gradually continued to get much worse the closer we were to the end of our meal. Just to be clear, we had all first arrived, there was no other patrons in any of the dining area, or bar area from what I witnessed. During the last thirty-five or forty minutes or so, none of us were even asked if we wished to have our drinks refilled [water], and all but one were empty most of that time. 

SERVICE GRADE:  FAIL

Now let us discuss the food quality and taste. The Steak and dishes served this particular night, I would consider average at best. The dishes were fine, nothing tasted bad, but certainly there was not one item placed in front of us that stood out. This includes the Steak. My wife and I dine out frequently, and have done so together for years. We would equate the food placed in front of us for this experience at the same level as what someone would receive at say, while eating at a Texas Roadhouse. It is edible, but nothing is going to 'Wow' you.

FOOD QUALITY & TASTE:  C+

We will now address "Customer treatment after the meal, and during the time we attempted to use our acceptable, recognizable, and ALL LEGAL forms of payment. My wife and I requested for a certain amount of our balance to be handled as a 'Split Payment'. A portion was to be taken care of by a Groupon we had in our possession, which was completely good and certainly had not expired. We also had a GIFT CARD, which Randy's Steakhouse issued.  Here is Wikipedia's definition of a Gift Card [ = Cash Equivalent].
"A Gift Card (also known as Gift Certificate in North America, or gift Voucher or Gift Token in the UK[1]) is a prepaid stored-value money card usually issued by a retailer or bank to be used as an alternative to cash for purchases". The 'On Duty Manager' would not take our Randy's issued Gift Card [as Cash Equivalent]. My suggestion to Randy is, if you do not wish to treat it as a 'Cash Equivalent', then do not call it a Gift Card. This is the only business I have ever come across in thirty plus years of being in business that doesn't seem to understand the simple definition of what a Gift Card is, and that it is 'Cash Equivalent'.  When the On Duty Manager told us that their Randy's issued Gift Card would "not be honored with the Groupon, due to them both being 'Promotional items'", and that "we can use the Gift Card on our next visit", we almost in unison stated and instructed "We won't be back, so you can throw it in your trash".  Grade for Customer treatment, and what any sane business person would consider 'Business knowledge and Business Etiquette 101'?  The owner needs to read the definition under what he offers promotions, cash equivalents, et cetera. If Randy's Steakhouse does not wish to treat it as a 'Cash Equivalent', then do not issue it as a 'Gift Card'. Either that, or print the 'Rules of use' ON the Gift Card.  

CUSTOMER TREATMENT: Fail

It seems a large percentage of the Reviews I read on this restaurant are not positive. My wife and I are in agreement, and we will never dine there again - even if it was free.   

.    Now here is where things get interesting.
 

We have dined at hundreds of Restaurants in both the good ole USA, and a large number of foreign countries.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
As for the issues you had with payment, I do have to stand by my manager who let you know that we weren't able to combine a Groupon with a gift card. While I can understand why you were disappointed, having expected to use both, they are considered promotional items, and in my experience, it's standard not to allow promotional items to be used simultaneously. All of that said, I wish we'd shown you a wonderful evening before that conversation ever even happened. At our price point, we certainly don't want to serve you anything "average," and we pride ourselves on offering service that's just the right amount of attentive -- I'm sorry that wasn't your experience, and I plan to speak to the team about it. Most of our reviews don't read like yours -- I wish we'd given you a reason to plan your second visit like most of our customers do.

All the best,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mediocre Ribeyes At Best
data.text: Our son usually takes us out for our anniversary and tries to pick a nice spot every time. He knew that we love a laid back setting and a cozy atmosphere so when someone at work mentioned Randy's he made reservations . In addition he invited our best friends to come along. The atmosphere was wonderful, the service excellent, the steak --well not worth it to say the least. Tough---not just mine but all of us who had Ribeyes that night. Took mine home and threw out the rest. It wasn't only me that felt this way but my husband who had the 16oz and our friend who had the 12oz as myself . We were gracious, smiled, and thanked our son for celebrating our 44nd anniversary and including our friends as a surprise. The steaks were a bust but the desserts were good. Enjoyed the mousse and the bread pudding was excellent. Will never come here for steaks again.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Moriah, first of all, happy anniversary to you both, and thank you for letting us host! It was so generous of your son to take you all out to celebrate, and I wish we'd made a better first impression on such a special occasion. You loved the atmosphere and the service, but you came for the steak. Ribeyes are meant to be one of the most flavorful and tender cuts, so I apologize if yours was actually tougher than expected. You said that you wouldn't return for a second helping, but I hope I can convince you to change your mind! You caught us on an off night, and though that shouldn't have happened in the first place, I know we can show you a much better meal given the chance.

All the best,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Steakhouse
data.text:
New to Frisco and I like supporting local businesses. I love steakhouses and being from Chicago I have tried the best. 

It was a great boneless ribeye that was cooked to perfection medium rare. My wife had the surf and turf. The lobster was a very generous portion. The staff and our waiter were very friendly and personable. 

Morton's, Gibson's, Ruth's Chris, Perry's, Gordon Steak, Pete Miller's are all my favs. Some of the steakhouses I just mentioned are only available in Chicago, but would definitely dine at Randy's again.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for supporting us, and more importantly, supporting local -- it means the world! I'm so glad we showed you and your wife the five-star experience you deserved. I sure hope I'll be getting the chance to welcome you back for more of that delicious ribeye you enjoyed so much.

Warm regards,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious and expensive five star restaurant
data.text: We had nine family members for a belated Christmas dinner. It was expensive , but the service was superb, the food was fantastic, and the ambience was perfect - fireplace and Christmas decorations . It is located in an old house on the quaint downtown Main Street. We had fun and it will be a great memory.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Pete! We're so glad that from the dishes themselves to the service and ambiance, the meal was a memorable one. Thank you and your family for letting us host! I hope we'll have the chance to do it again next time you spend the holidays in Texas. 

Safe travels, 
Randy B.

data.title: Not a fan
data.text: A great steak dinner is not cheap. And when everything tastes amazing, I'm in for the indulgence. But the quality here is ok, so to me, it's not worth the price. I think you can get a better experience at Capitol grill or 3-forks.

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review

We want to be your favorite steakhouse in town, Tracey, so I hate to hear that we've delivered anything less than a 5-star experience in the past. You said the quality was just okay, but let me know if you'd like to talk about what exactly we could have done better. I'm all ears!

Thanks,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing, but has potential
data.text:
My boyfriend and I went to Randy's last night. I had been once for steaks and remember it being okay. Another time, we went for Sunday brunch and it was good. We had not made reservations and went around 8:00pm. We were seated quickly, which was nice. The hostess was very sweet.

Our waiter was very friendly and has great potential. Unfortunately, he did not seem to have been trained. It was apparent that he had not been allowed to taste all of the menu options. I feel this is important since most people ask for recommendations. Also, he had not been taught to open a bottle of wine. After reading reviews on here today, it seems that may not be taught to most staff. The crumbs were not removed after the meal, which is standard practice in all of the other steakhouses Where I've eaten. I really hope he can get the training needed because he can be outstanding! Great personality!

As far as the food...bread was okay. I really liked the paprika butter, but my boyfriend did not. The steaks were supposed to be prime grade.  The NY strip was lower quality with significant sinew. The filet cane out sizzling on a plate floating in butter. When I cut into it, it was medium as ordered. After a few minutes, it was well done and had continued to cook on the plate. Mac and cheese was okay, but the forgot to put the crunchy topping on top. The waiter raved about this topping when we ordered. The creamed spinach was extremely cheesy with cheddar cheese. Pretty sure the spinach was frozen previously. Some bites were cold. The creme brûlée...I needed a hammer to break through the layer of caramelized sugar. The actual custard was good! As we are writing this review, we realize there was a problem with everything except for the bottle of Sterling Pinot Noir after it was finally opened. 

We did not complain about the food quality while we were there, since it wasn't bad enough to complain about.  The entire room to the right was closed off, so that may have been part off the issue. My boyfriend has eaten here and had good experiences, but stated that Randy has always stopped by the table. In his words..."Perhaps Randy was out while we were in." 

We love supporting local business which is why it is so sad to write this. The location, staff, and atmosphere have such great potential!

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Melissa, sorry to hear Thursday's visit wasn't one of our best -- we appreciate your decision to support local whenever possible more than you know. I apologize that your server's training didn't seem as strong as his personality -- I'll look into that personally and keep an eye on it. I agree that everyone on the floor should be able to speak to the menu and certainly open a bottle of wine properly. As for the meal, please accept our apologies that none of your dishes met your expectations. I hope we'll have the opportunity to welcome you back and show you our best on the next visit, and I also hope I'll be there to say hello.

All the best and please keep in touch,
Randy B.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food cooked perfectly!
data.text: Catch happy hour in the bar for great burgers and bar drinks!  Eat in the dining room for a more formal experience.  Everything on the menu is cooked perfectly, flavorful and tasty!  This restaurant is the perfect place to have a great meal and relax after any busy day!  Worth the price (really not too bad for good food).

owner_response.author: Randy B, Owner at Randy's Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Cindy! Whether you're grabbing a few drinks and a bite in the bar or sitting down with us in the dining room, we love having the chance to serve you. Thanks for singing our praises -- you made our day over here. 

Cheers,
Randy B.
